intro: Rinorea curtirama, commonly known as the velvetleaf or silverleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its broad, velvety leaves that give it its common name. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences. Rinorea curtirama is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests.
